{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year = 1996 |Team = Alabama Crimson Tide |Image= |ImageSize = |Conference = Southeastern Conference |Division = Western Division |ShortConference = SEC |CoachRank = 11 |APRank = 11 |Record = 10â3 |ConfRecord = 6â2 |HeadCoach = [[Gene Stallings]] |HCYear = 7th |Captain=John Causey |Captain2=Fernando Davis |OffCoach = |OScheme = |DefCoach = |DScheme = |StadiumArena = [[Bryant-Denny Stadium]]
[[Legion Field]] |Champion=SEC Western Division Champions |BowlTourney = [[1997 Outback Bowl|Outback Bowl]] |BowlTourneyResult = W 17â14 vs. [[1996 Michigan Wolverines football team|Michigan]] |ConfChamp= [[1996 SEC Championship Game|SEC Championship Game]] |ConfChampResult= L 45â30 vs. [[1996 Florida Gators football team|Florida]] }} {{1996 SEC football standings}} The '''1996 Alabama Crimson Tide football team''' represented the [[University of Alabama]] for the [[1996 NCAA Division I-A football season|1996â97 college football season]], competing in the Western Division in the [[Southeastern Conference]]. [[Gene Stallings]] led the Crimson Tide to a 10â3 record in his final year with the program. The team played their home games at [[Bryant-Denny Stadium]] in [[Tuscaloosa, Alabama]], and [[Legion Field]] in [[Birmingham, Alabama]]. Alabama's loss to Mississippi State broke a 15 game winning streak Alabama had in the series and was their first loss to the Bulldogs since a dramatic upset MSU posted over the #1 ranked Tide in 1980. Following a victory in the annual [[Iron Bowl]] on November 23, head coach Gene Stallings announced his retirement, which would go into effect at the end of the season.{{cite news| title=Tide prevails; Stallings retires: Auburn Bama both blow leads| publisher=The Atlanta Journal| pages=F1| date=1996-11-24}} == Schedule == {{CFB Schedule Start| rank=yes|ranklink=yes|rankyear=1996|tv=no|
